3 Cleaning 3.1 Custom packages with cleaning functions kobold/ butteR/ auditCheckR / Cleaninginspector 3.2 Setup # load packages library(tidyverse) library(cleaninginspectoR) # load raw dataset df <- read.csv("inputs/UKR2007_MSNA20_HH_dataset_main_rcop.csv", stringsAsFactors = F) 3.3 Cleaninginspector 3.3.1 Check for duplicates duplicated_uuid <- find_duplicates_uuid(df) head(duplicated_uuid) # check the output ## [1] index value variable has_issue issue_type ## <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names) # blank data frame will be returned if no duplicates found. 3.3.2 Check outliers outliers <- find_outliers(df) head(outliers) # numerical values with outlier values will be flagged ## index value variable has_issue issue_type ## 1 26 30000 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier ## 2 117 210 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier ## 3 225 400 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier ## 4 384 300 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier ## 5 517 300 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier ## 6 710 24000 b15_hohh_income TRUE log normal distribution outlier 3.3.3 Check survey time taken when checking the survey time taken, make sure the survey start and end time are included in your data. and also get the estimated survey time treshold durring the training or piloting stage so you can have a parameter to check if the survey were filled with the expected time range or not. in this case weâ€™ll assume the minimum time that the survey can be filled is 20 minutes and the maximum time is 40 minutes. so all surveys that fall out of this range will be flagged for verification. survey_time <- check_time(df, duration_threshold_lower = 20, duration_threshold_upper = 40) head(survey_time) ## index value variable ## 1 1a8f5939-fc1e-43f8-ac75-86fb6de3ae4c 14.50 Completion Duration (min) ## 2 ed87c6df-d78d-47bc-92dc-27d478073a53 18.24 Completion Duration (min) ## 3 54068bec-c615-446b-943f-e4354096057f 16.07 Completion Duration (min) ## 4 f086a293-d2b6-4447-97db-e0ad2fb7f4af 15.93 Completion Duration (min) ## 5 a2b0f489-36d8-4ff2-b5af-7d07feba2ef6 15.88 Completion Duration (min) ## 6 ea864b82-4879-4eba-bc8a-efb0cf19b4ce 19.69 Completion Duration (min) ## has_issue issue_type ## 1 TRUE form duration too short ## 2 TRUE form duration too short ## 3 TRUE form duration too short ## 4 TRUE form duration too short ## 5 TRUE form duration too short ## 6 TRUE form duration too short 3.3.4 Check other options check_others <- find_other_responses(df) head(check_others) ## index value ## 1 NA "Child of war" status /// instances: 1 ## 2 NA "Child of war" status, "Veteran of labour" status /// instances: 1 ## 3 NA A carer for a disabled child /// instances: 1 ## 4 NA A carer for a disabled person /// instances: 1 ## 5 NA Chernobyl liquidator /// instances: 3 ## 6 NA Child custody /// instances: 1 ## variable has_issue issue_type ## 1 b10_1_hohh_vulnerability_other TRUE 'other' response. may need recoding. ## 2 b10_1_hohh_vulnerability_other TRUE 'other' response. may need recoding. ##
